description: 1.5-hour written exam in Week 7 covering specimen preparation, crystallography, and X-ray diffraction. Includes short-answer questions and calculations.

Three individual assignments: Crystallography (Week 4, 10%), X-ray Diffraction (Week 7, 10%), and Electron Microscopy (Week 9, 15%). Tasks include crystallographic calculations, SEM simulations, and data interpretation.
2-hour exam during UNSW examination period covering electron microscopy, spectroscopy, optical microscopy, and image analysis. Includes multiple-choice, short-answer questions, and calculations.

Four practical labs: Metallographic Sample Preparation (2%), X-Ray Diffraction analysis (4%), Microscopy operation (4%), and Quantitative Microstructural Analysis using image processing (5%). Involves specimen preparation, equipment operation, and data analysis.
